meanings.definition: Causing a sensation of being tickled
meanings.sent1: The feather was so tickly on my skin.
meanings.sent2: Her laugh was so tickly, it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent3: The tickly feather made the serious meeting turn into a giggle fest.
meanings.sent4: The tickly sensation was like a playful dance on my skin.
meanings.sent5: The tickly feeling was as light as a butterfly's touch.

meanings.definition: Easily tickled or sensitive to tickling
meanings.sent1: His feet were very tickly and made him laugh.
meanings.sent2: The baby's tickly response to the feather was adorable.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't help but giggle at her own tickly toes.
meanings.sent4: The tickly reaction was like a secret that couldn't be kept.
meanings.sent5: The tickly sensitivity was as delicate as a flower petal.

meanings.definition: Inclined to tickle or cause tickling
meanings.sent1: The mischievous puppy was always tickly during playtime.
meanings.sent2: The tickly child loved to make others laugh with tickles.
meanings.sent3: The tickly kitten pounced on its toy with glee.
meanings.sent4: The tickly nature of the joke spread joy like a contagious laugh.
meanings.sent5: The tickly playfulness was as infectious as a smile.
